See also: Tänzen

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German tanzen. The adapted onset t- in Upper German dialects (and standard German) proves that the word was not borrowed directly from Old French dancer (the ultimate source), but via Middle Dutch dansen and Central German.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈtan(t)sən/, [-t͡sn̩], [-sn̩]
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Audio
    		(file)

Verb[edit]

tanzen (third-person singular simple present tanzt, past tense tanzte, past participle getanzt, auxiliary haben)

  1. to dance
